lead_paragraph: A historian’s hunt for details about the cover-ups surrounding the bloody 1971 prison uprising at Attica Correctional Institution in New York.

headline.print_headline: Peeling Back the Secrets of Attica
headline.main: Prying Loose the Long-Kept Secrets of Attica

snippet: A historian’s hunt for details about the cover-ups surrounding the bloody 1971 prison uprising at Attica Correctional Institution in New York....
abstract: Historian Heather Ann Thompson, in her latest book Blood in the Water: The Attica Prison Uprising of 1971 and Its Legacy, gives previously unpublished details of revolt and subsequent state cover-up, which she gleaned from trove of once-secret documents at Erie County Courthouse; has drawn criticism for revealing names of officers who may have committed murder during violent retaking of prison but were never indicted.
